meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let me tell you, folks, Cat Quest is one crazy cat lady (or gentleman) of an RPG. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, why are you reviewing a game about cats? Are you trying to drive away all the dog lovers and bird enthusiasts out there?" And my answer is, "Hey, someone's gotta keep it paws-itive around here!"

Okay, okay, let's get serious for a hot second. Cat Quest has some seriously cute visuals – I mean, who can resist those adorable kitty eyes? – and an action-packed RPG system that's easy to grasp. You play as a feline hero, exploring dungeons, battling monsters, and collecting treasures (because what's more treasure-y than catnip?). The combat's pretty straightforward, too: slash, dash, pounce – repeat ad nauseam.

Now, I know some of my fellow critics are saying, "Oh, it's just a cute little game for kids," but let me tell you, there's more to Cat Quest than meets the whisker. It's got some seriously tough moments, especially when those pesky doggos (I mean, baddies) show up. You'll need to keep your wits about you and those reflexes sharp if you wanna save those feline friends.

Some folks might say it's a bit too repetitive – I mean, how many cat puns can you handle? – but honestly, I found myself giggling along with the game's silly script (I mean, "Feline Frenzy"? Come on, that's some top-notch nonsense!).

All in all, Cat Quest is one heck of an RPG experience – and not just for cat lovers! If you're looking for a fun little romp that won't break the bank or require a PhD in RPG-ology, then this is the game for you. And if you are a cat lady (or gentleman), well... I think you know what to do here.

P.S. Don't worry, dog lovers – there's always Cuphead waiting in the wings for your attention.
